subject: Technology
title: Swarm Robotics: Power in Numbers
description: A fast breakdown of Swarm Robotics: Power in Numbers for builders.

hook.text: One ant is nearly useless. A million ants can build bridges, farms, and cities. Swarm robots work the same way.

buildup.text: Swarm robotics uses many simple robots following basic rules to accomplish complex tasks as a group.

discovery.text: Harvard's Kilobots demonstrated 1,000 tiny robots arranging themselves into shapes with no central controller.

twist.text: If one robot in a swarm fails, the rest adapt. The system is resilient because no single unit is critical.

climax.text: Future swarms could explore disaster sites, monitor ocean health, or construct buildings, all without human direction.

punchline.text: Simple robots achieve complex things when they work together.

quiz.question: What makes swarm robotics resilient?
options: Each robot has a powerful computer
No single robot is critical, so the group adapts to failures
